New Records: 102 is India's lowest all out total in T20Is in the last eight years.
Key Match Events: Zimbabwe scored 115 runs after losing 9 wickets.
India lost all its wickets at 102 and lost by 13 runs.
Shubman Gill scored 31 runs and Washington Sundar scored 27 runs for India.
Sikandar Raza and Tendai Chatara took three wickets each for Zimbabwe.
Ravi Bishnoi took 4 wickets for India.
Sikandar Raza was named 'Player of the Match'.
Pre-Game Insights: This was the first time India played in Zimbabwe since 2016.
The series took on new significance following the T20 World Cup victory and the retirements of Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma, and Ravindra Jadeja from T20 cricket.
Zimbabwe came into the series after losing their last series against Bangladesh 4-1 in May.
Post-Match Reflections: Shubman Gill expressed disappointment with the team's performance, mentioning they were not up to standard and looked rusty.
Sikandar Raza expressed happiness about the win and emphasized the need to take one game at a time and improve their skills.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The weather in Harare was 25 degrees at the start of the game, likely dropping to 15 degrees during the match.
Three Indian players made their international debuts: Abhishek Sharma, Riyan Parag, and Dhruv Jurel.
